properties.sfac:credit_line: Commissioned for the San Francisco International Airport; Collection of the City and County of San Francisco.
properties.sfac:display_dimensions: 19' di X 14' 5 D dome; 16' di floor; 612' 2" sections tile 42 1/2" L X 30.9" H
properties.sfac:location_description: Airport : IT : Concourse A : Arrivals Corridor
properties.sfac:title: You Were in Heaven
properties.sfomuseum:description: A ceiling dome, installed at one end of the corridor and lit through blue gels, is inspired by early creation myths that describe the sky as originating from ice crystals. On the floor below the dome are bronze and terrazzo medallion. As passengers pass through the dome and walk along the corridor wall, they encounter five 60-foot long curved niches. In these niches, groups of cast hydrocal tiles with forms derived from the mathematical theories of English mathematician Arthur Penrose, are fit together to create shapes that resemble clouds. The artist creates these complex forms using only 2 unique shapes of tiles.
properties.sfomuseum:medium: Fiberglass reinforced plaster, terrazzo, nickle silver medallion, lighting
properties.wof:label: Preston, Ann You Were in Heaven
properties.wof:name: You Were in Heaven
